topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5368291d63687236a2330000#post_5368291d63687236a2330000
[bq="twistedmetalero"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536827b763687206bc680000#post_536827b763687206bc680000

"take a illuminati satanist conspiracy blog for example":spiritspeakstruths.blogspot.com/2009/11/rain-man-in-music.html [/bq]
. . . Wait, wasn't lucifer yahweh's second in command angel though and that his position was that of leading the worship?  I would personally say that would be more along the lines of a pastor than a choir leader.  Also if I'm not mistaken wasn't the reason why lucifer rebelled against yahweh was that he loved god too much and viewed humans as imperfect?  Wouldn't that be more along the lines of a pastor leaving a church after having a argument against the church leader over new members he doesn't approve of?


. . . . Wait, I'm getting sidetracked again; anyways I don't get this in that when you think about it lucifer wasn't in charge of music.  The whole argument doesn't make sense.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
